net.objectzoo.ebc.join

Class JoinToPair<Input1,Input2>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.objectzoo.ebc.impl.ResultBoard<ResultParameter>
      • net.objectzoo.ebc.impl.ResultBase<Output>
        • net.objectzoo.ebc.join.Join<Input1,Input2,Pair<Input1,Input2>>
          • net.objectzoo.ebc.join.JoinToPair<Input1,Input2>
  • Type Parameters:
    Input1 - the type of input one of this Join
    Input2 - the type of input two of this Join
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    SendsResult<Pair<Input1,Input2>>

    public class JoinToPair<Input1,Input2>
extends Join<Input1,Input2,Pair<Input1,Input2>>
    This is a Join implementation that joins the two input values to a Pair. The Join waits for every input to be set at least once before creating a result event. Once both inputs have been set an output is created and sent. After that there are two different modes of operation depending on the resetAfterResultEvent parameter setting. If resetAfterResultEvent is set to true (which is the default) then after each result event the two input values are reset and the procedure to wait for both inputs starts from the beginning. If resetAfterResultEvent is set to false then for each following single input invocation a new output is created and sent until the Join is manually reset again. If reset the procedure to wait for both inputs starts from the beginning. To manually reset the Join the Join.resetAction() can be invoked.
    Author:
    tilmann
